content: generally I just right click the parent folder and select new folder from the menu.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
If the message folders are on your PC, you can move them in one of two ways:

  1. exit thunderbird, locate the profile folder, copy the desired message folders (probably in Mail\Local Folders folder) to external media. Ignore the msf file. On the Mac, follow same process of exiting thunderbird and copying the message folder to the Mail\Local Folders folder on the Mac.
  2. option two is to install the importexporttools addon on both. then, highlight each folder, rightclick, select importexporttools option to export mbox file. Then, on the Mac, highlight Local Folders, rightclick, and select the importexportools option to import mbox. repeat as needed.

However, if you want them all in same folder, use the importexporttools option to export eml and on the Mac,highlight the desired folder, and use the importexporttools option to import eml
creator: davidsk

content:
You have a pseudo mail server in proton bridge. I suggest you ask proton if there are known issues with the bridge. I would guess there are. You can no longerbrowser the issues on github like you used to be able to, so I guess like most commercial operators they are now subscribing to security through obscurity when their encryption does not obscure issues.

However the source of the product is still published. https://github.com/ProtonMail/proton-bridge

There is also a reddit community which they push to provide support. https://reddit.com/r/ProtonMail/
creator: MattAuSupport

content: If not done already, you could untick unified folders and then retick it. Thunderbird lists folders in the order created. That would let you have favorites at the top of the folder pane and account folders beneath.
creator: davidsk

content: La risposta è implicita nella tua domanda: devi impostare Norton in modo che non interferisca con la gestione dei certificati e l'accesso alla rete da parte di Thunderbird.

content: It may help if you share what release of thunderbird you use, complete error messages (if any) in English, and screenshot of your SMTP server settings pane. That may help someone here assist you. Thank you

content: I regret to inform you that Thunderbird is only an email client, not an email repository. I suggest trying the global search to locate it if it is still in your email folders.
creator: davidsk

content: Check the email address carefully. An accidental space or other character may be corrupting it.
creator: davidsk

content: There is a Spaces toolbar, usually vertical on left side. If not shown, click View>Toolbars and tick 'spaces toolbar.' If menu bar is not visible, press alt key first. The calendar icon is on the spaces toolbar.
creator: davidsk
